6.title: Practical exercises held at BoMI construction object
6.content:
Students of the 33rd and 31st seasons, specializing in "State Control at Construction Sites", are conducting their final practical lessons at the "BoMI" construction site of the Republic of Korea in Tashkent. These practical lessons are organized to further strengthen the students' knowledge of state control and legal aspects, as well as to gain practical experience.

The "BoMI" construction object is one of the modern and innovative projects implemented by South Korea and is of great importance in the development of Tashkent city.

The final practical classes conducted at the "BoMI" construction object were very effective. During these classes, students gained valuable knowledge and experience on effective implementation of state control in their professional activities. This will be of great help in their future activities.

5.title: Promotional event held at Deko-Kron construction enterprise
5.content:
As we have been noting, the Institute for Competence Development under the Ministry of Construction and Housing and Communal Services trains specialists operating in the field of construction and housing and communal services.

In order to ensure the execution of the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan No. 460 and to promote the essence of this resolution, officials of the Institute for Competence Development are conducting promotional work on site. Detailed information is provided on the procedure for certification of specialists, its specific requirements and opportunities.

In particular, today's event took place at the Deko-Kron construction enterprise.

"Today, just like in all areas, there is a high demand for modern technologies in urban planning. The practical application of these technologies requires great responsibility, knowledge, and skills from the employee. In this sense, we have developed our education system based on the latest innovative solutions. Theoretical and practical knowledge provided in our training courses will serve to increase the efficiency of your future activities," said institute official F. Mamajonova.

It should be noted separately that these promotional events serve as a prelude to important work on improving the sphere.

4.title: Training courses on “Requirements and Practice of Seismic Isolation Application”
4.content:
In order to ensure the implementation of the tasks defined in paragraph 26 of the “Roadmap for improving the system of ensuring seismic safety and increasing the earthquake resistance of buildings and structures”, approved by Appendix 1 to the Resolution of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated April 17, 2024, No. PQ-161, we announce the organization of training courses entitled “Requirements and Practice of Seismic Isolation Application” at the Institute for Competence Development for specialists of design, construction organizations and the state construction control inspection.

The duration of the training course is 44 hours (1 week).

Course listeners will learn:

  • practical methods of ensuring earthquake resistance of buildings and structures by studying foreign experience;
  • modern design and construction in seismically hazardous areas;
  • use of normative and technical literature on the project and construction of buildings and structures in seismic zones;
  • application of modern methods for assessing the seismic resistance of buildings and structures;
  • solving the main principles of design and construction in seismically hazardous areas;
  • mastering the principles of design, construction and operation of earthquake-resistant buildings taking into account life safety requirements;
  • methods of calculating buildings and structures for seismic effects, including skills in using automated calculation software systems.

State-issued certificates will be awarded to course listeners who have fully mastered the educational programs and successfully passed the final control.

For detailed information about the course, you can contact 71 241-58-01, 93 350-30-13.
